p.span: Welcome to Evesham Township School District

img.title: ETSD World
img.style: font-size: 13px; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: 0.3px; left: 639px; width: 262px; height: 225px; float: right;

p.span: Our goal is to provide you with an overview of our district, programs and extracurricular offerings, as well as keep you updated on various events/activities occurring within the district. This site will also direct you to key personnel who will be happy to further assist you should questions still remain. Click here to read a complete summary report about our school district, or here for an at-a-glance view.

Please be sure to register on our site to receive emergency email alerts, additional district information and updates. Click here to register. If you have already registered, these directions can also be used to edit your profile.

table.style: border-style: solid; border-width: 1px; border-color: rgb(0, 0, 0); border-collapse: collapse; width: 788px; height: 285px;

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-size: 13.3333px; font-family: Arial;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px; color: rgb(0, 32, 96);

p.span: The mission of the Evesham Township School District is to promote excellence in an environment that engages students in meaningful learning experiences. In partnership with students, dedicated staff, families, and community, the district provides a strong educational foundation that will empower our students to:

li.style: font-family: Arial; line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; margin-left: 80px;

span.style: background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px; color: rgb(0, 32, 96);
font-size: 14px; background-color: transparent; white-space: pre-wrap; letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 32, 96);

li.span: Develop the skills necessary for appropriate risk-taking and responsible decision-making

span.style: font-size: 14px; background-color: transparent; letter-spacing: 0.3px; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 32, 96);

li.span: Become contributing members of a diverse, global society

p.span: In keeping with our mission statement, the Evesham Township School District continues to promote and maintain a positive school climate and culture at each of our schools that encourages civility, respect and caring. Click here to read our District Policy on Harassment, Intimidation and Bullying.

span.style: font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; letter-spacing: 0.3px; background-color: transparent; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-size: 14px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 112, 192);

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-size: 13.3333px; text-align: center;

span.strong: Annual District and School Grades Under the Anti-Bullying Bill of Rights Act

span.br: All schools are required by the state to annually complete a Self-Assessment in order to assist the state in determining school and district compliance in implementing the Anti-Bullying Bill of Rights (ABR) Act. Click here to review a PowerPoint presentation that was provided to the board outlining the process and summary results for 2017-2018. In June of 2019, the state released an official report containing this data, which was used to assign school and district grades. The school grade is a raw score of data and the sum of the ratings for all indicators within each core element on the Self-Assessment. The maximum total score for a school is 78 points. The district’s grade is an average of the total scores of all schools in the district. Click here to view the state report that includes all school and district grades. In order to foster safe and positive learning conditions for students, this data, along with feedback from School and District Safety Teams, is used as part of an integrated process for reinforcing and strengthening our school and district climate and culture. Click here for additional resources on Harassment, Intimidation and Bullying Prevention.

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-size: 13.3333px; text-align: center;

span.style: white-space: pre; font-family: Arial; font-size: 18px; color: rgb(0, 112, 192);

p.style: line-height: 1.38; margin-top: 0pt; margin-bottom: 0pt; font-size: 13.3333px; text-align: center;
p.span: At the elementary level, all schools

span.style: font-size: 14px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 112, 192);

p.span: integrate the Responsive Classroom Approach (RCA). A core belief of the approach is that in order to be successful in and out of school, students need to learn a set of social and emotional competencies, as well as designated academic competencies. These include CARES and Traits of Growth Connections, which are part of our comprehensive health and PE program, and also coincides with our anti-bullying initiativ

span.style: font-size: 14px; letter-spacing: 0.3px; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(0, 112, 192);

p.span: e. Click here for more information on Responsive Classroom.

a.aria-label: Read More About COVID-19 School Closure, Preparedness Plan & Outside Facility Cancellations

div.div: COVID-19 School Closure, Preparedness Plan & Outside Facility Cancellations
div.p: ETSD will be closed from Monday, March 16th through Friday, May 15th. Click here to review various communications about COVID-19 (coronavirus) and remote learning.

a.aria-label: Read More About Calling All Incoming 2020-2021 Kindergarten Students

div.p: Registration is now open for incoming kindergarten students, click here to initiate the process.

a.aria-label: Read More About Genesis Parent Portal

div.p: The portal is a great communication tool for parents to utilize during the school year. Click here for features and to learn how to update contact information.
